SENT.plain: The paper presents diagnostic problems and therapeutic management in a case of 34 year old woman with antiphospholipid syndrome (APS) connected with overlap syndrome: autoimmune hepatitis (AIH) and primary biliary cirrhosis (PBC)
Life threatening cardiac arrhythmia was the first clinical manifestation of the disease
Pulmonary embolism occurred a few months later, with the presence of antiphospholipid antibodies
The diagnosis of AlH and PBC was made as a result of further research of complex immunological disturbances observed in the patient and after liver biopsy
